turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Sami, tomorrow you lift a wallet from someone who looks like one of us.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We need to rent a car and for that you need a credit card.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: That's an excellent plan.     Very comforting.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We'll think of something.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Besides, we don't know the city and--

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Mr. Bastaldi isn't asking you if you want to go. He's telling you you're going! And if he's telling you you're going to be going then you are going to go!

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: You think it's smart to tell him we're French?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I think he's already figured that out.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: That moron.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: It was an honest mistake. Ridgeway... Ridgeroad... Ridgeway Road.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Everyone get some sleep.    We're leaving in the morning.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: The deal is whatever Mr. Bastaldi says it is.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You know, if you could get your nose out of Bastaldi's ass for two seconds you might see what's going on around you.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Did you know about Bastaldi's deal with Zammito?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: I think if he told me he was going to steal Van Gogh's "Sunflowers in a vase" I would remember it.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Fuck you! You know I'd never go along with something like this.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Do I?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: This ain't about that and you know it. This is about you never forgiving me for leaving the crew.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You call being Bastaldi's lap dog better?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Better than spending my life crawling through windows in the middle of the night.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: I'm not a guy who is known for his patience and right now you're testing mine.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: What is that a threat? Are you fuckin' threatening me, Marcel?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We had a chance to walk out of Zammito's house.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: We all agreed to it. You had no way of knowing Bastaldi was setting us up.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I just want to live long enough to get back to Paris. Just long enough to kill Bastaldi.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We still have to get out of here.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Maybe if we gave the tapes back --

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: This is Zero.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Hi. I'm one and this is two, three, four and five.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: After the outside alarm is off we go in through the bedroom window.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Good. Zero and Julien will go in through the window and disable the motion detector. The rest of us will come in through the front door.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: We've got to be careful not to use our real names while we're in here.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I'll be Elvis and you--

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: It's not?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: That's Frankie Zammito.   The Under boss of the Chicago Mafia.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: How'd it go? I don't know.     Daniel, how would you say it went?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I would have to say... pretty fuckin' bad. You gave us the wrong address Sophie.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: What's the big deal? It's not like I was on guard duty or something.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You didn't think it was little suspicious that someone you only knew for a few hours wanted to sleep with you?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No.   Chicks dig me.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: They'll be waiting for us at the airport.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You steal some money from a man he gets over it in time. But these tapes. He's never going to stop looking for us.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: We have to find Sophie.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It makes sense. I mean, do you really think he would come along if he knew we were being set up?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I think he'd cut his dick off if Bastaldi told him to.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: All right, knock it off.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: All you are is a professional ass-kisser.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Hadley --

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Has to be.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It's not your fault, Daniel.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Okay. Airports, train stations, bus station are out. We know they're connected to the car rental agencies because that's where they picked up Raymond.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Even if we get out of town and go to another airport I'm sure the FBI and Chicago P.D. has alerted customs.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Get out of the room! You've got company coming up. I'll meet you at the Chevy.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: What's he joking around for?    He's been shot.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: He's been shot a lot.    He's used to it.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Anybody hungry?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: What'd you get?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Some bread and...

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Can I trust you, Sami?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Hey, who warned you that they were coming up to the room?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: If they had taken us by surprise they would have gotten the tapes back. That would have left us with nothing.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No, that would have left me with nothing because all of you would be dead.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You haven't answered my question.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Does it really matter what I say?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I'm leaving you with my friends. I'm trusting you to do the right thing today.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You better.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Did you have to use that much explosive?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I promised Bonanno I'd destroy the tapes.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I'll be right back. He gets out of the car and walks over to him.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: What do you want now?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Guns.   Can you get them?

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Man, I can get anything.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Don't bullshit me.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: I ain't bullshittin'. I can get guns. I can get any kind of gun you want. But they ain't gonna help your sorry ass. You ain't been in town one day and already you got two of the toughest people in Chicago looking for you. How is that possible?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I've got a way with people.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: I can see that. The man's car you stole. Raphael Ruiz. He's head of the 19th Street gang and one crazy motherfucker. And Frankie Zammito's got the word out he's looking for some French dudes. You're French ain't ya?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I'm from Belgium.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Yeah, I'd be from Belgium too if I was you. You know Zammito just put his own brother in the hospital? Broke his arm cause he was late on a debt. I mention this to illustrate the kind of people who are lookin' for you.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Why haven't you turned us in?

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: I ain't no rat.  You got money, right?

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: And, uh, I'm going to have to charge you a commission... kind of like a brokerage fee.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: A thousand dollars?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Hey you guys are becoming famous.      I was just watching the news and--

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: -- Did you set it up?

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Yeah. All set. Tomorrow morning. Ten o'clock. Room 211. Barclay Hotel on River Street. Oh, and due to your recent notoriety and the heat that comes with it, I'm going to have to increase my brokerage fee to twenty five hundred.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We had a deal.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: We had a deal before you and your friends became the new poster boys for crime.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Fine.     Ten o'clock.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: There's ten grand in here. It's yours. I'm going to call you again. There's one more thing I need you to do.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I'll tell you when it's time.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Okay, we're square now, right?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: There's just one more thing I need you to do.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Maybe you should call the police.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: Hey, idiot -- I've got stolen wheels and a stolen radio in the car.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: I just thought that--

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: -- Don't think. Okay?        You're not good at it.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: -- you stole my cousin Enrique's car.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: Hector, don't interrupt me.

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: He told Enrique he didn't know anything about his car.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: I don't give a shit about your cousin's car. We're here about my car. So, shut your mouth! You think you can do that? You think you can keep your big mouth shut?

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: Tell me the truth Hector... do you think we'll find my car?

turns.speaker: HECTOR
turns.text: Hard to say.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: What'd I tell you? Huh, Vinny? What'd I tell you when you came to me for money? Didn't I ask you not to do it? Did I not say that?  What'd I say to him?

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: You said don't do it, boss.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: That's right. I said don't do it. Did you listen to me? No. You wanted the money. So, I lent you twenty large. Now it's been three weeks and you ain't paid a dime. What do you think that makes me look like on the street? I don't do something to you and everyone will think they can skate.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Hey boss, it's not a science.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Send some flowers. Something nice. Roses or carnations. And one of those get well soon cards.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: They were all French guys.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: French guys?    You mean like from France?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yeah, French guys from France.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: What'd they take?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Everything?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Boy, you must be pissed.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Well, you know, when five guys break into my house in the middle of the night, stick guns in my face, tie me up and steal from me... it does irritate me.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Well, I must say you're handling it very well.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: You know why I'm handling it very well? Because you're going to get these guys for me.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Okay boss.   Where are they?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: If I knew where they were you wouldn't have to find them, would you?

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: You didn't say find them. You said, "get them."

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Just find them!

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Okay boss.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: But we ain't had nothing to eat all day boss.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Can you believe that guy?    What a moron.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Good song though.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Great fuckin' song.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: What'd you guys find?

turns.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
turns.text: Dead bodies. The ones in the Lincoln are your... associates.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: And the other car?

turns.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
turns.text: Some French guy. At least that's what his passport said. You know Joey, I shouldn't be talking to you about this.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Are you forgetting who supplements your income?

turns.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
turns.text: No. It's just that the French guy had a gunshot wound on his neck. So, this is a homicide. Are you guys involved in this?

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Yeah. I'll come down and make a full confession later. Right now, tell me what else you found?

turns.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
turns.text: A Wallet.    A hotel room card.    Some cash.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: What hotel?

turns.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
turns.text: The Holiday Hotel.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: What room number?

turns.speaker: UNIFORMED COP
turns.text: I don't know.     I didn't look.

turns.speaker: JOEY "TWO TONS"
turns.text: Go look.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: The map said to go left.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Yeah and if you turned it around it would say to go right.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: There has to be.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I'm telling you I've pulled out everything in the safe. There aren't any jewels.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: There must be half a million dollars here though.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: I was told to take what we have and go.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Go where?   The police are outside.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: They don't have a wine list.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Oh, then we will have the house wine.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: There's an exterior alarm system. There's also another one in the hall that leads to the bedroom with a motion detector. The control panel is in the bedroom.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I can handle the exterior alarm, but the one in the bedroom is a problem.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: What about transportation?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: You can use my car.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Bastaldi got the address from you, yes?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: And he gave it to us.    145 Ridgeway Road.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: No.    145 Ridgeroad Way.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I'm Sami.    Marcel sent me.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: What is it you do, Sami?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You know, a little of this, a little of that. I've boosted cars, stole radios, run a few scams. Right now I'm into pick-pocketing.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I see.   A master criminal.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Hey, I was told to come here by Marcel. You guys don't want me, I'll be more than happy to leave.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: They don't serve wine here.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: What kind of restaurant doesn't serve wine?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: This kind.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Okay.    I will have a beer.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I don't know.     Maybe if we did just leave --

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: C'mon, get real, will you. You think he's just going to forget about this? These guys are all about respect. All about honor. He's coming after us, so we might as well take the money.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No wonder Zammito didn't want us to walk out with this stuff. He's planning on killing Bonanno and taking over the family.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: This wasn't the deal! The deal was to steal a necklace, not get in the middle of a Mafia war.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I knew this was a mistake! I knew it last night when you asked me to go along with this. I could hear that little voice in my head saying, "don't do it! Don't you do it!" Jesus, why don't I ever listen to myself?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Yeah, but you did do it.   So let's deal with that.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: This is bad. This is really fuckin' bad. Am I the only one who sees how bad this is?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Hey, it's not your picture on the TV, it's mine. So, try to be cool.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Don't tell me to be cool! We were supposed to be in and out. In and out! In the last twenty four hours we've managed to get the Mafia... the FBI... the Chicago Police Department and a group of Latin gang members after us. I haven't left out anyone, have I?  I don't think so, because we've already pissed off everyone in the fuckin' city!

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: We've got to get out of here.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: That's brilliant! Care to elaborate?

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Maybe I'm missing the obvious, but why aren't we leaving town? Any place has to be safer for us than Chicago.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It doesn't matter where we go. Between Zammito and the FBI they'll find us. We have to end this here.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Oh, man... this is bullshit!    You can't trust anyone these days.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: She took everything!    Didn't even leave us cab fare.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I am not comfortable with this.   I'm not a good liar.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Relax. It will be fine.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I'll drive.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I'm the driver.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I've never driven a Cadillac before.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: This is a car. I think this is the best American car I've ever driven.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: This is the only American car you've ever driven.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I knew I should have driven.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Stop talking. I'm trying to concentrate.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: When we get to the next corner jump out.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I'm not going to leave you.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: We both know I'm already dead.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: A Black Panther was a member of an African American militant group in the sixties, Marcel. I think you're referring to The Pink Panther.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Pink panther, black panther. Who gives a shit? And I don't remember asking you a God Damn thing, you little turd.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: There's no reason to be abusive. You're projecting your anger on me as a defense mechanism.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: What the hell is he talking about?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I'm talking about human beings communicating openly and honestly.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: How about getting on your knees and communicating with my dick?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: No.   How much?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I don't know.     It's gotta be millions.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: How about Canada?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: What are we going to do, take a taxi?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Going somewhere?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Oh, Marcel! I thought you were somebody else. If I knew it was you I would have never run.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Today's your lucky day, Sami.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Yeah, I can see that.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Normally I'd be breaking your fingers right now, but I'm going to give you a chance to make enough to pay me back and have some extra for yourself. We have a group going to Chicago to do a job. You're going with them.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: You lived there. You know the city.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I've still got a few legal problems back in the States.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: -- I want to be Elvis.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It's my idea.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: C'mon, I look more like Elvis than you do.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Okay.   You can be Elvis.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: We have a problem. Problem isn't the right word. Dilemma. No that really doesn't describe --  Do you know who that is?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Mr. Taylor?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No, that's not Mr. Taylor.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Why would they want us to rob the Mafia?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: "Vase with twelve Sunflowers."

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Whatever! He never told me about the Van Gogh or any of the other paintings.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You guys used to work together?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Yeah and he can't stand it that I tried to do something to better myself.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It's good.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: God, I want to go home.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Hey, you know you can't this in France.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: This is great. After everything we've been through we've got eight hundred euros and an autographed baseball.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: The baseball is mine.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No! You can't have the baseball! You're not entitled to the fuckin' baseball!

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Fine. All of you want to be angry? Be angry... but I'm the one who took the ball and that makes it mine.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Give it to me, Sami.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: How's my brother?

turns.speaker: NICKY "THE RAKE"
turns.text: He's over at St. James. They had to put two pins in his arm.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: I said a clean break.

turns.speaker: NICKY "THE RAKE"
turns.text: Who is closer to the wall, Joey or me?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Get in the car.

turns.speaker: NICKY "THE RAKE"
turns.text: Just tell me who's closer to the wall?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: NICKY "THE RAKE"
turns.text: They sort of got away.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: I see. Well, get back out on the street and find them before I "sort of" kill you.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: Anybody know about that car outside?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yeah.   It's mine.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: No.   It's mine.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: The hell it is.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: I'm telling you that's my car!   And someone's gonna pay for it!

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: And I'm tellin' you it ain't! Now, turn your taco-eating ass around and get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: RAPHAEL
turns.text: Fuck you, grease-ball!

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Fuck me?   Fuck you!

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Mr. Zammito?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I represent a person who wishes to remain anonymous, but is aware of your current financial problems with your brother.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I understand. The person who sent me wishes to help you.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: You see that car?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: It's yours. A gift. A gift you could give to your brother... or anyone you owe money to as partial payment.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: No shit?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: The papers for the car will arrive tomorrow.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I am Raymond.     Thank you for allowing us to stay here.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: No problem, man.  Hey, you wanna hit?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Oh, Pepe Le Pew. He is very funny and quite well known in France.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Yeah, I dig him.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Although a cartoon I feel he shares a universal theme: We are all searching for love. No?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: How are we going to do that?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: I know where she went.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I would like to thank you for your hospitality.  If you are ever in Paris here is my number.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: He speaks about himself in the third person?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Feel free to correct him if you want.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I'm glad you didn't get something flashy.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Watch this.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I think we went the wrong way.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Oh, you think?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: How do we know what room she's in?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Wait here.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: The money isn't here.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Where is it, Sophie?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I said knock it off! Now as far as I'm concerned you two girls can bitch slap yourselves silly when this is over, but right now we've got to figure out what's going on.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: It's simple. Bastaldi's moving up. He's closing down his operation and this is his way of saying thanks to all of us.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You're not helping.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Julien, what you're doing right now is a very normal psychological reaction to stress. You're projecting your anger onto us.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I say we make him pay first. After that you can do whatever you want to him.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: He's right. Do you have any idea what Van Gogh's "Vase with twelve Sunflowers" is worth?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: The new Beaujolais' come out in France next week. You like wine?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I'm more of a whiskey drinker myself.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: J&B?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Glenmorangie.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Glenmorangie is very good.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Algeria.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: And you don't speak French?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Well, you know, not all Algerians speak French. It's a matter of what school you went too. Me I never really --

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: -- Zero isn't interested in your life story.  Who gets killed?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You put a loaded gun in your bag and brought it through customs? How stupid is that?

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: Zero did not put it in his bag.    He put it in yours.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I can't even hear myself think.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: How are we supposed to sleep with this noise?
